result.execSummary:
The defendant Lesha Ann Pacala was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lesha Ann Pacala

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Called at 3:23. Also called 12CM74. Lesha Pacala appears in person and in custody with attorney Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns - have global resolution - on 14CF105 - amend count #1 to misd possession of cocaine, #2 - DRI, joint recommendation of 100 days in FC jail with huber - 13 days credit (8/27/14 to 9/9/14). Court has Burns explain jail credit. Court dismisses and reads in count #2 and amends count #1 to misd possession of cocaine deleting any 2nd or subsequent offense contrary to 961.41(3)(c) - reads new charge and penalty. Pacala pleads NC to count #1 as amended. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Pacala makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - 100 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - credit for 13 days, costs - take bond posted, refund remainder, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on January 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Called at 2:11 PM. Lesha Pacala appears in person and in custody with attorney Mary Burns. State appear by Charles Simono. State - asking for a week adjourment to get matter resolved. Court will continue bond, set for FPT on 1/14/15 at 3:30 PM.
Final pre-trial on January 7, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Final pre-trial on December 10, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 3:22 PM. Lesha Pacala appears in person and with counsel Mary Burns. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. Burns - waiving PH and provides court with that information. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial, set for FPT. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Burns will proceed to ARGN, has Information, waives reading of it, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT on 12/10/14 at 1:15 PM.

ADDRESS INFO for Lesha Ann Pacala
Current: 3609 West Greenfield Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53215 United States  (Effective: 10-01-2014)
Prior: 5088 Billy Daniels Lane, Crandon, WI 54520
and Certificate of Appearance - Crandon Police Officer JS
Preliminary hearing on October 1, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Lesha Ann Pacala in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:21 AM. Burns has complaint waives further reading and requests preliminary hearing, willing to waive time limits for PH. Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 10, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Called at 10:17 AM. Lesha Pacala appears via video from FOSO and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. Pecala has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Pacala understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, can afford her own. Court refers to SPD, instructed to contact them, sent court appointed paperwork with notice. Court continues bond, set for AIA on 9/10/14 at 9:30 AM, instructed to contact an attorney ASAP.
